title: How to Freeze and Preserve Herbs in Olive Oil

steps.headline: Pick through the herb crop to select the heartiest specimens.
steps.description: Remove wilting or browning fresh herbs.

steps.headline: Remove dirt or debris from herbs.
steps.description: Depending upon the type of herb, either wash thoroughly or remove debris using a wet paper towel. Don’t forget to allow herbs to dry completely before freezing.

steps.headline: Pair/partner herbs.
steps.description: Determine if you want to combine certain herbs to achieve a specific type of flavor (or for certain dishes you plan to make in the future) or you will freeze a singular herb in each ice cube tray.

steps.headline: Chop the herbs so they fit neatly inside the ice cube tray compartment.
steps.description: Chop or cut either small pieces of sprigs of the herb. You want a neat fit (no pieces sticking out of the oil cube).

steps.headline: Fill each compartment of the ice cube tray with herbs.
steps.description: Fill approximately 2/3 of the way to the top with your herbs.

steps.headline: Add olive oil to each compartment of the ice cube tray.
steps.description: Fill almost to the top but take care not to overfill or spill.

steps.headline: Cover the tray with plastic wrap and place in freezer.
steps.description: Stack the trays if you are creating multiples.

steps.headline: Freeze overnight or for several days.
steps.description: Don’t leave trays in the freezer for too long as other food in the freezer may intermingle with the cubes, compromising the taste.

steps.headline: Remove trays from freezer and pop cubes from tray.
steps.description: Release the cubes in a clean plate or surface.

steps.headline: Place the cubes in plastic freezer bag.
steps.description: Make sure each bag is clearly marked with the date and contents of each cube.

steps.headline: Return the well-sealed bags to the freezer and use as needed.
steps.description: Use cubes for up to 6 months or for two seasons (freeze in the summer and use for fall and winter meals).

tyn: Heavy duty plastic wrap and freezer bags
A permanent magic marker so you can identify your frozen herbs
